main event: A civilian witnessed a cylindrical-shaped object with flashing lights in the sky over Girard, Ohio on August 6, 1966.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a small airplane, traveling at a very slow rate of speed and appeared to be stationary at times.
The object was observed for a period of 15 to 20 minutes and then just disappeared.
The witness attempted to get a closer look using binoculars but could not focus in time.
The witness reported the sighting to the control tower at Youngstown Municipal Airport.
The Air Force investigated the sighting and concluded it was an astro (meteor) with insufficient data.
